259892.<speed=0>\n大富豪の 基本ルールについて\n確認することが できます。: <speed=0>Here you can review Tycoon's basic rules.<break>

259893.<speed=0>\n大富豪の対戦のうち\n『段位戦』『なかま対戦』『ひとりで練:
This will explain "Ranked Battle", "Party Battle", and "Playing Alone" for Tycoon.
"Ranked Battle" matches you with 3 other players and you will play with the Ranked Rules, which change daily.
In a Ranked Battle match, you will play 3 games and compete for the highest number of points.
"Party Battle" lets you play with friends and you'll play with the party leader's chosen rules.
However, please be aware that you'll earn less Card Points in a Party Battle than in a Ranked Battle.
When you have less than 4 players for a Party Battle, the empty spots will be filled by computer-controlled opponents.
In "Practice Alone", you can choose your own rules, but you won't receive any Card Points.
In both Party Battle and Practice Alone, you can choose the amount of games to play, up to total of 4 games.
Play Ranked Battle to test your own skills, and play Party Battle to enjoy casual games with your friends.

259894.<speed=0>\n各プレイヤーには 階級があり\n１ゲーム目は 全員「平民」:
Each player has their own rank. During the first game, every player is assigned the rank "Commoner".
When the first game starts, the player holding the three of Diamonds becomes the dealer and makes the first play.
Players take turns playing card(s) that are stronger than the cards currently on the board. The first to play all the cards in
their hand wins the current game.
When the next game starts, players are assigned a rank based on how well they did in the previous game.
The ranks are, in order of highest to lowest: Tycoon, Rich, Poor, and Beggar.
From the second game on, players exchange cards with one another based on their current rank.
The Tycoon gives 2 cards of their choice to the Beggar, and in return receives the Beggar's 2 strongest cards.
The Rich gives 1 card of their choice to the Poor, and in return receives the Poor's strongest card.
Also from the second game on, the Beggar becomes the new dealer.
After all games finish, the final standings are determined by the total number of points earned.

259895.<speed=0>\n自分のターンでは カードを出さずに\nパスすることもできま:
During your turn, you may choose to pass instead of playing a card.
If everyone else passes after you play a card, all cards in play are discarded and the board clears.
When the board clears, you become the dealer, and can begin the round by playing any card you wish.
You may pass as many times as you like, but remember that you cannot pass if you are the dealer.

259896.<speed=0>\n自分のターンの時や カードを選ぶ時の\n制限時間は <%n:
The time limit for taking your turn and selecting cards is <%dM_timelimit> seconds. If you run out of time, your turn will be skipped.
When you are the dealer and run out of time, a card will be automatically played for you.
If you run out of time in this way twice in a row, you will be forcibly removed from the game. Please be mindful of your actions.

259897.<speed=0>\nカードの強さは 弱い順に並べると\n３ ４ ５ ６ ７ ８:
The strength of cards from lowest to highest is as follows: 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, Jack, Queen, King, Ace, 2, and Joker.
Cards in different suits will still have the same strength depending on its number.
However, a Joker can be used as the strongest card even if there is a Revolt or 11 Back occurring.

259898.<speed=0>\n場に１枚 カードが出ている時\nより強いカードを １枚出し:
When there is 1 card on the board, you must play 1 card that is stronger than it.
When there are no cards on the board, you may play multiple cards at once so long as they are all the same number.
If multiple cards are played, the next player must play the same number of cards. If they can't, they must skip their turn.
A Joker can be used as a substitute for any card when playing multiple cards at once.

259899.<speed=0>\n大富豪には 基本ルールのほかに\n追加ルールがあります。\:
In addition to the basic rules, there are also additional rules.
You can check the explanation of each rule by using "Custom Rules Settings".

To receive your rewards, please speak to
Tycoon Club Member Pugol in Luckland.
<end>
